thread.title: Chelsea news: Cesc Fabregas banned team-mates from speaking to him after losing place | Metro News
thread.title_full: Chelsea news: Cesc Fabregas banned team-mates from speaking to him after losing place | Metro News

author: Tom Olver For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Chelsea news: Cesc Fabregas banned team-mates from speaking to him after losing place | Metro News
text:
Tom Olver for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 10:55 am Antonio Conte dropped Cesc Fabregas at the start of the campaign (Picture: Getty) 
Cesc Fabregas has revealed that he ordered his Chelsea team-mates to stop talking to him after he lost his starting place at Stamford Bridge. Jurgen Klopp sends warning to his Liverpool flops after Leicester loss 
The midfielder has only made 17 league appearances this season but has found his way back into Antonio Conte’s starting XI in recent weeks, scoring two goals in his last three games in the English top flight. 
Fabregas made only his sixth start of the campaign against Swansea at the weekend and grabbed an assist and a goal as Conte’s men opened up a ten-point lead at the top of the table. 
‘In the beginning when I didn’t play, I told people not even to speak to me because I was really upset,’ he admitted after the 3-1 victory over Paul Clement’s side. Antonio Conte has been impressed with Cesc Fabregas in recent weeks (Picture: Getty) 
‘I can understand there are doubts with the philosophy of the manager. 
‘He came in, wanted to see if I could adapt and I can understand that. I’m someone who wants to play with the ball, maybe not so much the defensive side. Chelsea fixtures 
West Ham (A) – Mon 6 Mar Manchester Utd – FA Cup (H) – Mon 13 Mar Stoke (A) – Sat 18 Mar Crystal Palace (H) – Sat 1 Apr Manchester City (H) – Wed 5 Apr Bournemouth (A) – Sat 8 Apr Manchester United (A) – Sat 15 Apr
